intro: Celsia suworowiana var. pseudopersica, commonly known as the Persian bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It features showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are slightly hairy and arranged alternately along the stem. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. This variety is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in gardens for its delicate floral display.
